title: (x) Johnny Osbourne "Truth and Rights" old reggae album cover - Beans, Pump {Mark S}
content:
I’m wondering what the Johnny Osbourne type is, and second of importance the Truth and Rights font....  
Anybody know a similar font or any ideas where these fonts came from? Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks!

-danny

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [J.OsbourneIMG.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195656/http:/typophile.com/files/J.OsbourneIMG.pdf) | 126.02 KB |

 [‹ (x) Zara Spring/Summer 2007 flourished script - Dalliance {Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195656/http:/typophile.com/node/33492 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Split Rock Resort & Golf Club logo - Tango {Tim Bridle} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195656/http:/typophile.com/node/33483 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
“JOHNNY OSBOURNE” looks custom, possibly based on something like Frankfurter or Octopuss. Kada could get you close.

“TRUTHS AND RIGHTS” might be Tabasco.

- Lex

“TRUTHS AND RIGHTS” is actually closer to Blippo. Maybe it uses pre-digital alternates.

- Lex

“Johnny Osbourne” is an old Letraset font called Beans. I don’t know of a digital version.

“Truth and Rights” is [Pump Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195656/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pump-lt/).
